thread.title: Former Australian of the Year finalist Eman Sharobeem exits boards, SBS amid fraud investigation
thread.title_full: Former Australian of the Year finalist Eman Sharobeem exits boards, SBS amid fraud investigation

author: Michael Evans
title: Former Australian of the Year finalist Eman Sharobeem exits boards, SBS amid fraud investigation
text:
The Bondi to Manly walk The Bondi to Manly walk 
John Faulkner, former defence minister; Di Westaway, founder of Coastrek; and Lachlan Harris, co-founder/CEO of One Big Switch, are looking to establish the Bondi to Manly harbour walk. More videos From child bride to community campaigner 
Dr Eman Sharobeem migrated to Australia more than 30 year ago, since then she has earned two PhDâs and campaigned against issues such as forced marriage and family violence. 
A Supreme Court order prevents Ms Sharobeem from disposing of three Sydney houses and her car. She and her sons Richard and Charlie have been ordered to front court to answer questions concerning her assets. 
Last year, Ms Sharobeem was appointed National Community Engagement Manager at broadcaster SBS. Asked on Monday if Ms Sharobeem enjoyed the broadcaster's support in the role, a spokeswoman said: "Eman is no longer employed by SBS. SBS has no comment on the investigation." Related Content NSW finalists for Australian of the Year announced 
It's understood she resigned in the past week, having been on medical leave since November. 
While her CV on the social media employment site LinkedIn says she holds a series of public offices, Ms Sharobeem has resigned from her role an advisory board member at Multicultural NSW. Advertisement 
Her term was not due to expire until September 2017. 
Multicultural NSW said in a statement: "Eman Sharobeem resigned as a member of the Multicultural NSW Advisory Board on 14 November 2016 due to other work commitments and health concerns." SHARE
